page.title: 17GARDEN CENTRES: WARLEY
page.content: Garden Centres are an intensive and highly profitable form of land use. The proximity of urban centres in London's suburban belt means that they are highly active in the area. There are two main ones. Warley Rose Gardens Ltd.,595894, specialises in{roses}and has a{national market,}mostly in the Home Counties, but extending as far as Scotland and to Cornwall. Roots and Shoots, in Nag's Head Lane 563908, has a smaller market, mostly confined to a 25 mile radius. The{M25}has helped to widen this market considerably. The centre specialises in{unusual shrubs and{alpines.}Over 2000 Clematis are sold a year. Two-thirds of the business is at weekends, and Â£8,000 may be taken on a good day. The plants are mostly purchased from specialist growers in the UK, prior to resale at the centre.
